result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Simone Sinclair Hughes

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Simone Sinclair Hughes not in court, in custody.  Attorney Chad Wozniak in court for State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm 
Status Conference held.  Court appointed Attorney Scott Anderson to represent the Defendant at County Expense.  Due to the State Public Defender failing to timely appoint counsel, the court appointed counsel at Milwaukee County expense.  Case adjourned for Scheduling Conference.  Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 34, Judge Yamahiro in Room 423 of the Safety Building.
Scheduling conference scheduled for January 3, 2023 at 08:30 am.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report received and filed.  bm
Attorney Harris informs the Court he is unable to accept appointment.  Court converts October 27, 2022 at 2:00 pm to a State v Lee Hearing.  Public Defenders Office notified this date.  bm

Defendant Simone Hughes in court, in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm 
Case recalled.  Court advises the Defendant he is appointing Thomas Harris to represent the Defendant.  Attorney Harris contacted and will advise the Court on October 6, 2022.

Defendant Simone Sinclair Hughes in court, in custody.  Attorney Chad Wozniak in court for State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm 
Case calendared for Status of Counsel this date.  Defendant has not retained counsel.  Defendant removed from courtroom.  Case passed to 1:30 pm

Defendant Simone Sinclair Hughes in court, in custody.  Attorney Ian Vance-Curzan for Chad Wozniak in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk:  bm 
Case in court for Status of Counsel.  Defendant advises the Court his family has not been able to retain counsel as of this date.  Court adjourns matter.
Status conference scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Simone Sinclair Hughes in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Simone Sinclair Hughes in custody.  Jennifer Jean Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Defendant advises he will be retaining counsel within ten minutes.  Case adjourned for Status of Counsel.  Status conference scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.
records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Defense filed Motion to Withdraw.  Parties agree via email to August 17, 2022 at 8:30 am to address motion.  bm
Motion to Withdraw received and filed.  bm

Defendant Simone Sinclair Hughes in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Simone Sinclair Hughes in custody.  Jennifer Jean Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Scheduling Conference held.  Defense requests a final pretrial and jury trial.  Court advises any motions are to be filed by September 1, 2022.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Notice of Intent to use DNA Evidence at Trial.  Received and Filed.  nk

Defendant Simone Sinclair Hughes in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Simone Sinclair Hughes in custody.  Jennifer Jean Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: nk
Case in Court for Scheduling Conference.  Defense has Discovery and request time to review.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Simone Sinclair Hughes in court with Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke; both appear by video.  Defendant Simone Sinclair Hughes in custody.  Jennifer Tate appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 12, Judge David Borowski. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial.  Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 12.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
State Public Defender - Order Appointing Counsel received and filed.  bm
No Contact Order signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with KH-W, dob 5/10/2007; JEA, dob 7/9/1992.

Defendant Simone Sinclair Hughes in court with attorney Joan Elizabeth Zawikowski.  Defendant Simone Sinclair Hughes in custody.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Simone Sinclair Hughes appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Borowski, Branch 12.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a Preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.   DEFENDANT QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
K-Warrant
